title: Bronze is killing me
body: So, I've been in Bronze from day one, I made the mistake of doing my provisionals before I was good enough, per say. Now I've been just stuck with these just really stupid players in bronze. Like wow just finished a game with inspired me to create this post, Pantheon top,  Annie mid 1/9, Nunu supp 0/4, team refuses to leash jungler because it's 'too far away', so being the charmer he was he just afk'd and me adc 5/5. This is a typical bronze match for me. I try so hard to communicate with the team but it's bronze no one listens to anyone. I've found adc is the best position for me to 'carry' as I have won the most games playing it. Is there anyone kind enough to give me some tips to get out of Bronze or carry me out?

replies.body:
I went 26/0 as vayne and still lost because of the team. I need a duo carry or something
That's ur problem. You need to get over people being bad and focus purely on you. Your mindset it seems is already "all about me" Imagine if you had 12 kills as vayne instead of 26, and ur apc had 8 of those kills and ur jungler had 6. You need to share kills. Regardless of weather they're bad or not, sharing is caring. By stealing all of the kills you steal all the gold avaliable for other people, any wonder you think ur teams are %%%% they have no gold to buy items while you get it all.
Even if someone is bad they can still cast spells and use auto attacks, and more money for them=more dmg for the team.
These are just some things I notice adcs doing that can jeopardise your teams effectiveness. 
Pushing other peoples lanes as an excuse to get big waves, stealing jungle camps and buffs without asking for them (buffs are your junglers present to give, not your property to take) and the obvious problem here, taking more kills than you need.

It may not feel right giving kills to your team if they're just plain %%%%, and maybe sometimes you will indeed solo carry you way to victory, but this play-style sets you up for a real %%%%ty time when you move up the leagues where everyone expects team play, not complete selfishness.

This is how I Learnt to get over nubs in bronze and I escaped successfully, I'm no pro but managed a 67% win rate with nautilus doing this play style, NAUTILUS, the one champ with removes the hyper from hyper carry :P if i can do it, you can do.

If you want to get out of Bronze, you have to stop getting so worked up about your teammates. Every player has to deal with the same teammates. Assuming you yourself are a positive influence on your team, then statistically it's more likely that the enemy team will have a feeder/troll/AFK. 

Ignore your teammates and focus on what YOU can improve on - Winning lane, CS, vision control, focussing on objectives etc.
You can't pick your teammates, you just need to deal with it and focus on yourself.

If you are good enough you will leave bronze eventually. Everyone who was ever bronze has dealt with this crap and managed to climb out. Despite what you may think, it is about you and how good you are.

There is a lot of good advice here. Remember though, the reset is coming soon. We don't know when, but it will come. Everyone will need to do provisionals again. There is always hope for those ones.

I also did my provisionals far earlier than I should have and ended up in bronze. 

I hated playing ranked in bronze so much because of the people in there (trolls flamers afkers), so I went back to normals for a while (a number of times)...

Its crappy but here is my advise:
Just play normals for a while, duoing with a friend if you can.
I play a lot of mid/jg duo and it makes it that much easier to carry.
Practise getting dragon ASAP (tank bot / mid at about 7 minutes to force them out of lane and get drag with your duo and hopefully others if they will come).
Each time dragon spawns, get it ASAP. Dragon is OP as hell if you have 5 of them and the enemy team has none.
Wards! Buy a pink early and drop it somewhere. Get your duo to do the same. In bronze, half the time people never even kill them, so you have permanent vision of 2 places on the map the whole game if this works out... Use greens as well whenever possible.
Practise these things in normals, and when you are feeling comfortable you can do it all well and win > 50% of your games, then go into ranked and do the same.

You WILL get LOADS of trolls in games still, and you will lose a heap of games because of them. Just remember that the people on the other team are probably trolling as well just as often as your team is. If you can win > 50 of the games without trolls, you will climb, even if it's slowly.

Just give it time, and ignore the games lost due to trolls. Concentrate on winning the game without them.

I'm up to B1 again now, so hopefully I can climb out too when I get a chance to play more! :)

Good luck!

communication doesnt win bronze games. solo carrying does.

find a champ or role you can effectively carry from in a high % of games.
stomp your lane, and if its mid or bot, use it to roam. if top, push 2-3 towers before roaming.
try reset killers like kat and akali. or just insane lane winners like fizz syndra.
or really strong safe ADCs like trist and corki.
or massive powerhouse top laners like panth nasus and J4.
or early game junglers who dont fall off if played well like lee WW (a rushed lvl 6 is still decently early enough to impact the game quickly) panth and vi.

i recommend not playing jungle or support, as you usually still rely on your team a lot in those roles.
if you can get ahead early enough you can secure dragons and towers with any of the carry lanes. and a TP top laner can help with decent pushes or dragons if the timing works out.

either way, its not hard to get out of bronze. its just really slow if you have been there for a long time. as your MMR gains are pitiful once you have over 100 games in a tier/league.

Here is a golden Ranked Logic example. One of my noob friends (like, fresh level 30, 100 or so wins noob friend) played all 10 provisional games in one hit, all consecutively. I honestly expected him to lose them all, like in so many of the stories I had heard of people doing this as soon as they hit 30 too; No offence to him of course.

So anyways, this guy ended up winning only a mere 2 out of 10 games total, in both of which he got carried like a baby in a mothers arms. This is his first ranked gameplay he had ever experienced, and he ended up placing silver 5 from it. When I played my Prov's, I won 4 out of 10 and got placed Bronze 1. So I was and still am totally gobsmacked as to how this is possible.

Focus on your CS, don't die, don't flame, mute the enemy team, mute your team if they're flaming.
Go watch some high level streams, they're usually good at teaching skills to carry low elo games.
